Query Area and Download Shapefiles¶

Code for interacting with the Census TIGERWEb API

class get_census.tigerweb.BBox(xmin=- 19672448.7545, ymin=- 1678452.6019, xmax=16268273.8027, ymax=11543642.4852)[source]¶

Internal class defining a simple bounding box

subdivide(factor=2)[source]¶

Create list of BBox objects that break up the axes of the parent obejct by factor. I.e. A factor of will create child BBox objects

Parameters

factor – Factor to subdivide by

Returns

List of sub-boxes

get_census.tigerweb.download_geometry(geometry, year=2019, out_dir='.')[source]¶

Get spatial information for a census geometry in geojson format and save it to disk

Parameters

  • geometry – type of census geometry to use

  • year – Year to get geometry for

  • out_dir – Directory to save downloaded files in. Note that due to requiring multiple downloads, tract and block group downloads will create a directory if no out_dir is defined.

Returns

None, downloads files only

get_census.tigerweb.get_area(geometry, sq_mi=True)[source]¶

Create a data frame of Census GEOIDs and Area. Due to the Tigerweb API’s limiting of the number of features per query to 100,000, block groups aren’t currently supported through this wrapper.

Parameters

  • geometry – type of census geometry to use

  • sq_mi – Should areas be converted to square miles?

Returns

pandas data frame

get_census.tigerweb.tiger_line_url(geometry, year)[source]¶

Return URL (or URLs) of zip file(s) containing shape files for a given census geography

Parameters

  • geometry – name of census geometry to download

  • year – year of geometry to download

Returns

List of URLs

get_census.tigerweb.tigerweb_endpoint(geometry)[source]¶

Get the API endpoint for making queries to the census tigerweb

Parameters

geometry – type of census geometry to use

Returns

string of rest API URL endpoint

get_census.tigerweb.tigerweb_params(attributes=['GEOID'], split_factor: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

Create a list of dictionaries of the necessary parameters to query the census tigerweb API. Returns a list to enable combining of queries that return sets larger than the maximum number of objects

Parameters

  • attributes – List of names of attributes to include. You should always include “GEOID” to enable linking of features with other census data

  • split_factor – Factor to divide the bounding box by to enable splitting up of large queries

Returns

list of dictionary of needed parameters
